intro: Raddia oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf raddia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated, oblong leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Raddia oblongifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
